oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Women; Hats; Dresses; Cliffs; Mountains; Sightseers
Ryman, Mary Elizabeth Baugh, 1847-1920; Ryman, Thomas Green, 1841-1904; Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Grand ole opry (Radio program); Lookout Mountain (Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Image of several women posing on Lookout Point.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: S. S. Eaton & Co., Lookout Mountain
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Included in this photo of adventurous females are Mary Ryman (back row, third from left) and her daughter Daisy Ryman (front row, fifth from left). Mary was the wife of Thomas G. Ryman, Nashville riverboat captain and businessman; Daisy was one of his daughters. Daisy and her sister Pearl both married Coggins brothers and moved to Georgia. Mary later died in Atlanta (1920) and was brought back to Nashville for burial at Mt. Olivet Cemetery.
